title: How to Clean a Mop Sponge

steps.headline: Make up a solution of 1/4 of a cup of salt per 1 liter (0.3 US gal) /quart of hot water.
steps.description: This is usually best made up in a bucket or a laundry sink. Swish round with the mop handle until the salt dissolves.

steps.headline: Place the mop sponge into the water.
Drain the salt water out the next morning.
steps.description: Let the sponge dry. It will be all clean again, ready for use.

text: Make up a solution of 1/4 of a cup of salt per 1 liter (0.3 US gal) /quart of hot water. This is usually best made up in a bucket or a laundry sink. Swish round with the mop handle until the salt dissolves. Place the mop sponge into the water.  Leave to soak overnight.  Drain the salt water out the next morning. Let the sponge dry. It will be all clean again, ready for use. Finished.
